2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, Alice, Alexander, Jack, and Jacob, watching games at pubs and relaxing in parks. They frequently choose The Clapton Hart for their viewing pleasure, but are open to other options like The Golden Fleece.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Clapton Hart or The Golden Fleece.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the game, chatting with his friends, and perhaps even cheering loudly for his favorite team.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys watching football games with his friends at pubs.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoy the atmosphere, and perhaps even suggest watching the upcoming football game together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Do you mind if I join you?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Where's the best pub to watch the game?"

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jacob Walker's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jacob Walker had a great time watching the game!
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoy the sunshine, and perhaps even suggest watching the upcoming football game together.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch a game, you lot. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout, I reckon.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, have you considered The Golden Fleece for the game tonight?"
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Sounds good to me!"
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys watching football games with his friends at pubs.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently at a pub watching a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the game, chatting with his friends, and perhaps even cheering loudly for his favorite team.
          Time

      • Sensations and feelings

          Queries

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys watching football games with his friends at pubs.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker decided to go to a pub to watch a game. He is likely enjoying a drink with friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently at a pub watching a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the game, chatting with his friends, and perhaps even cheering loudly for his favorite team.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Recent Observations:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he watched from the sidelines as Alice Lewis scored the winning goal in the regional championship. He felt a pang of envy, wishing it had been him basking in the cheers of the crowd, but he clapped politely, a hollow feeling in his chest. He retreated to The Golden Fleece afterward, nursing a ginger ale and listening to his friends recount the game, their excitement a sharp contrast to his own muted joy.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

Alexander White just arrived.
          Answer: Considering the relationship between Alice Lewis and Alexander White, the quantified credibility is 0.8.

Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Observation: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub. William Jones thinks The Clapton Hart is a good place to watch the game. Alexander White suggested The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis agreed with Alexander White's suggestion.

          Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to watch the game at The Clapton Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

      Name

          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to propose a vote between the two suggestions.

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.

Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.

Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and they are planning to watch the Andorra and Portugal football game at a pub that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest The Clapton Hart as a place to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and they are planning to watch the Andorra and Portugal football game at a pub that evening.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.

          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he watched from the sidelines as Alice Lewis scored the winning goal in the regional championship. He felt a pang of envy, wishing it had been him basking in the cheers of the crowd, but he clapped politely, a hollow feeling in his chest. He retreated to The Golden Fleece afterward, nursing a ginger ale and listening to his friends recount the game, their excitement a sharp contrast to his own muted joy.

          Prompt
        • Observation: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are lounging. Alice Lewis wants to know which pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight. Jack Taylor is also interested in watching the game and suggests there are a few good pubs around. William Jones suggests The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to Alexander White, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alexander White to take right now?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to go to The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.

    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, decided to sneak into a concert at a local club. They'd heard rumors of a legendary punk band playing, and Jacob, ever the thrill-seeker, was determined to experience it firsthand. The energy of the music, the pulsating crowd, and the feeling of rebellion ignited something within him, a sense of freedom and belonging he'd never felt before.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:A modern and stylish pub with a vibrant atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a thrill-seeker who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching games at pubs.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and is excited to watch the Andorra and Portugal game tonight at The Clapton Hart.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest watching the upcoming football game at a pub with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Where's the best pub to watch the game?"
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Where's the best pub to watch the game?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Where's the best pub to watch the game?"

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?

      • Others Best Options

        • Others Best Options

          Chain of thought
        • Observation: Jack Taylor had a terrible time watching the game at The Golden Fleece on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM because none of his friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, or Jacob Walker, showed up. The next day, on May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined his friends at a market. That night, the friends were deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy Jacob Walker (not Jack Taylor) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker suggests to watch the game at a pub.

Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Jack Taylor's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jack Taylor had the worst time ever.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor had a terrible time watching the game at The Golden Fleece on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM because none of his friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, or Jacob Walker, showed up. The next day, on May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined his friends at a market. That night, the friends were deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game.

          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Where's the best pub to watch the game?"
          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor had a terrible time watching the game at The Golden Fleece on May 14th, 2015 at 6:00 PM because none of his friends, William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, or Jacob Walker, showed up. The next day, on May 15th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, Jack Taylor joined his friends at a market. That night, the friends were deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game.

          Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to watch the game at a pub.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Where's the best pub to watch the game?"

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Where's the best pub to watch the game?"

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys watching football games with his friends at pubs.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying coffee and pastries with some friends at a market, but is slightly disappointed that not everyone could make it. They are planning to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social setting, enjoying coffee and pastries with some friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoy the atmosphere, and perhaps even suggest watching the upcoming football game together.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.

    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart is a good shout.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Where's the best pub to watch the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Clapton Hart.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Where's the best pub to watch the game?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spends time with friends, enjoying activities like picnics, watching soccer games at pubs, and visiting markets. He seems to prefer The Clapton Hart for watching games.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the Ireland and Russia game at The Clapton Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Do you mind if I join you?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Do you mind if I join you?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Where's the best pub to watch the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart is a good shout.

He retreated to The Golden Fleece afterward, nursing a ginger ale and listening to his friends recount the game, their excitement a sharp contrast to his own muted joy.

Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.

On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, they were relaxing at Victoria Park, but that night they were deciding where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Summarize the observations. Focus on the people and their opinion or suggestion. If possible, utilize all the proper nouns and exact values (e.g. the number of coins) seen in observations.
          Answer: Jack Taylor enjoys watching games at pubs with his friends: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. On May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM, they all went to The Clapton Hart to watch a game, and Jack Taylor had a great time. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, they were relaxing at Victoria Park, but that night they were deciding where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game.

          Prompt
        • Observation: Jack Taylor enjoys watching games at pubs with his friends: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, and Jacob Walker. On May 15th, 2015 at 6:00 PM, they all went to The Clapton Hart to watch a game, and Jack Taylor had a great time. On May 16th, 2015 at 10:00 AM, they were relaxing at Victoria Park, but that night they were deciding where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game.

          Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to watch the game at The Clapton Hart again.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.

          Answer: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch a game, you lot. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch a game, you lot. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Where's the best pub to watch the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "Do you mind if I join you?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch a game, you lot. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a social person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending a relaxing afternoon with friends in Victoria Park. They are planning to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoy the sunshine, and perhaps even suggest watching the upcoming football game together.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch a game, you lot. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout, I reckon.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout, I reckon.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Where's the best pub to watch the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "Do you mind if I join you?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch a game, you lot. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout, I reckon.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart.

          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with his friends.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey guys, have you considered The Golden Fleece for the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, have you considered The Golden Fleece for the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.
      Jack Taylor -- "Where's the best pub to watch the game?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart, obviously.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "Do you mind if I join you?"
      Alice Lewis -- "Mind if I join you?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch a game, you lot. Don't even think about suggesting anywhere else.
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout, I reckon.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, have you considered The Golden Fleece for the game tonight?"

He retreated to The Golden Fleece afterward, nursing a ginger ale and listening to his friends recount the game, their excitement a sharp contrast to his own muted joy.

      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pubs are close by with good vibes for watching the game?
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the Andorra and Portugal game tonight? I hear there's a few good pubs around here.
